Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Did the PRRA Officer err in assessing the risk to an HIV-positive individual returning to Nigeria?
Governing_Law: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Facts: The officer selectively used evidence, ignored relevant documentation about HIV risks in Nigeria, and failed to conduct a present and prospective risk assessment.
Decision_Outcome: The Federal Court found the PRRA and H&C decisions unreasonable and referred them for redetermination.
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of PRRA and H&C decisions
Court_Ruling: Both decisions were set aside, and the case was remanded for re-determination by a different PRRA Officer.
Claimant_Status: HIV-positive permanent resident (Ogbebor) facing removal to Nigeria
Defendant_Behavior: PRRA Officer's selective use of evidence and failure to properly assess risk
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of harm due to HIV status upon return to Nigeria
Assessment_Factor: Present and prospective risk to an HIV-positive individual in Nigeria
Evidence_Used: Documentation regarding HIV-related risks in Nigeria
Application_Basis: Risk of persecution or danger under IRPA
Evidence_Assessed: Evidence on conditions for HIV-positive individuals in Nigeria
Relief_Sought: Redetermination of PRRA and H&C applications
Governing_Rule: PRRA decision must reasonably evaluate evidence regarding risks under sections 96 and 97
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider relevant evidence on HIV risks
Outcome: Decisions set aside; remanded for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Potential harm to HIV-positive individual returning to Nigeria
Cause_Description: Ogbebor, an HIV-positive Nigerian, faced potential risks upon return to Nigeria, which were improperly assessed by the PRRA Officer.
Evidence_Handling: Selective use of evidence, ignoring key documentation
Legal_Provision_Violated: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Incomplete and biased evaluation of evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Unreasonable assessment due to omissions and selectivity
Decision_Rationale: The assessment failed to meet the required standard of reasonableness
Evidentiary_Issues: Ignored relevant documentation on HIV-related risks in Nigeria
